instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SSD_RESET_L: What is SSD_RESET_L? SSD_RESET_L is a signal that puts the SSD in reset mode when it is low. This means the SSD will not be accessible when this signal is asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder ssd drive missing
threads.message: Hey guys working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> was water damage near the <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>, lets be clear its not an efi lock because i can boot up with an external drive. When i checked disk utility the drive is missing so we can move on. i ultrasonic that area but still no luck the main voltages going to that chip seems to be present no known shorts either any idea on this Duke.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder ssd drive missing
threads.message: Life boat jumper connector present in J9600?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder ssd drive missing
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder ssd drive missing
threads.message: NAND getting power on <RESISTOR>R9430</RESISTOR>? <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD</SIGNAL> present? Crap under <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> is of course also very possible, check outputs on L9330/40

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder ssd drive missing
threads.message: Nand voltage at <RESISTOR>R9340</RESISTOR> is 2.639V very close to 2.7 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD</SIGNAL> is 3.346V Crap was under <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>   L9330 is 1.230V   L9340 1.822V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder ssd drive missing
threads.message: This is not looking good then. It is either still a half dead <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> or the NAND got corrupted when liquid hit <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder ssd drive missing
threads.message: I guess all i can do is order a <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> from Louis replace it and keep my fingers crossed ill let you know the outcome.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder ssd drive missing
threads.message: Hi duke replaced <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> still flashing folder any ideas where to go from here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder ssd drive missing
threads.message: The NAND probably got corrupted. Boot from external and see if Disk Utility is seeing something.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder ssd drive missing
threads.message: it boots from external and disk utility sees only external drive

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder ssd drive missing
threads.message: This sadly sounds like a done case. :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Flashing folder ssd drive missing
threads.message: Thanks for making my day so sad but i have a question i noticed on the schematic there is an <SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  is it possible there is a ssd command like the smc reset check out the schematic and tell me what you think
